citation.case_name: DeFebio v. School Bd. of Fairfax Cty.

html:
357 U.S. 218

78 S.Ct. 1363

2 L.Ed.2d 1361

Theodore Thomas DE FEBIO, an infant, etc., et al., appellants,
v.
COUNTY SCHOOL BOARD OF FAIRFAX COUNTY et al.

No. 677, Misc.

Supreme Court of the United States

June 16, 1958

Messrs. C. Douglas Adams, Jr. and Albert I. Kassabian, for appellants.

Messrs. A. S. Harrison, Jr., Atty.Gen. of Virginia, Kenneth C. Patty, R. D. McIlwaine, III, Asst.Attys.Gen., and John C. Wood, for appellees.

PER CURIAM.

1

The appeal is dismissed. Treating the papers whereon the appeal was taken as a petition for writ of certiorari, certiorari is denied.

v.

No. 677, Misc.

C. Douglas Adams, Jr. and Albert I. Kassabian for appellants.

A. S. Harrison, Jr., Attorney General of Virginia, Kenneth C. Patty and R. D. McIlwaine, III, Assistant Attorneys General, and John C. Wood for appellees.

PER CURIAM.

The appeal is dismissed. Treating the papers whereon the appeal was taken as a petition for writ of certiorari, certiorari is denied.
